mission: We're building an AI-powered project management platform that eliminates busywork for software teams. Our intelligent automation reduces project overhead by 60%, letting engineering teams focus on building great products instead of updating spreadsheets and status reports.
segments: Mid-market SaaS companies (50-500 employees) with distributed engineering teams, particularly those struggling with remote collaboration overhead and context-switching between multiple tools.
valueProps: 1) AI-powered status updates that write themselves from Git commits, Slack messages, and calendar events 2) Smart deadline prediction using historical velocity data 3) Automated stakeholder reporting with natural language summaries 4) Single source of truth replacing 5+ disconnected tools
channels: Product-led growth through free tier, content marketing targeting engineering leaders, strategic partnerships with dev tool companies, and targeted LinkedIn outreach to VPs of Engineering at growth-stage companies.
revenue: Tiered SaaS subscription: Starter ($29/user/month for teams under 10), Professional ($49/user/month with advanced AI features), Enterprise (custom pricing with SSO, dedicated support, and on-premise options). Additional revenue from implementation services and custom integrations.

contingencies.revenue: If revenue drops 50%, we will: 1) Immediately reduce team size by 20% (non-engineering roles), 2) Cut all paid marketing spend and focus on organic content, 3) Accelerate enterprise contract pipeline with aggressive discounting for annual prepayment, 4) Explore strategic acquisition by larger PM tool company, 5) Extend runway by negotiating deferred compensation with leadership team for 6 months.
contingencies.competitor: If a major competitor enters the market, we will: 1) Double down on our unique AI differentiation and release advanced features 2 months ahead of schedule, 2) Lock in existing customers with multi-year contracts offering 25% discount, 3) Pivot to vertical specialization (focus exclusively on software development teams vs. general PM), 4) Explore exclusive partnership with major developer tools platform (GitHub, GitLab, Atlassian) for embedded distribution, 5) Launch aggressive comparison marketing campaign highlighting our technical superiority.
contingencies.customer: If we lose our primary customer segment, we will: 1) Rapidly pivot to adjacent segment (product teams vs. engineering teams) by adjusting messaging and feature prioritization, 2) Conduct 50 customer interviews within 30 days to identify next best segment, 3) Develop industry-specific versions for high-potential verticals (fintech, healthtech, edtech), 4) Consider acqui-hire exit to preserve team and technology, 5) Explore horizontal expansion into general team collaboration vs. project management only.

founders.name: Sarah Chen
founders.background: Former VP Eng at Asana, 12 years experience

milestones.title: MVP Launch & First Customers
milestones.description: Launched beta with 15 design partner customers, achieved 80% weekly active usage rate, validated core value proposition of AI-generated status updates

milestones.title: Product-Market Fit Validation
milestones.description: Reached 100 paying customers, achieved <5% monthly churn, secured first enterprise contract ($50k ARR), launched self-service signup flow

milestones.title: Scale Operations & Team
milestones.description: Growing from 8 to 15 team members, implementing sales process, launching partner program with 5 dev tool integrations, expanding AI capabilities

milestones.title: Series A Preparation
milestones.description: Hit $100k MRR, establish repeatable sales motion, achieve 3:1 LTV:CAC ratio, build data room and investor pipeline for Q1 2025 raise

milestones.title: Series A Fundraise
milestones.description: Close $8-12M Series A to fuel go-to-market expansion, double engineering team, and expand into European market

okrs.objective: Achieve Product-Market Fit and Sustainable Growth

keyResults.description: Reduce monthly churn rate to under 3%
Ship 8 major AI features based on customer feedback
Achieve Product-Qualified Lead (PQL) conversion rate of 25%
Generate 500 qualified marketing leads per month

risks.description: OpenAI API costs spike as usage scales, destroying unit economics
risks.mitigation: 1) Implement aggressive prompt optimization and caching (targeting 40% cost reduction), 2) Build proprietary smaller models for common tasks, 3) Pass through AI costs to customers in pricing tiers, 4) Negotiate volume discounts with OpenAI and evaluate alternative providers (Anthropic, open-source models), 5) Set usage caps per customer tier

risks.description: Major competitor (Asana, Linear, Monday) launches similar AI features
risks.mitigation: Focus on depth of AI integration vs. surface-level features, build proprietary training data moat from customer usage, establish strategic partnerships with dev tools for distribution lock-in, move upmarket to enterprise where switching costs are higher, emphasize our engineering-team-specific optimization vs. general purpose

risks.description: Key engineering talent departs before Series A
risks.mitigation: Implement vesting acceleration upon Series A close, offer retention bonuses tied to fundraise milestone, cross-train team members on critical systems, document architecture and codebase thoroughly, maintain strong engineering culture and competitive compensation, conduct quarterly stay interviews

risks.description: Data privacy incident or security breach damages reputation
risks.mitigation: Achieve SOC 2 Type II certification by Q1 2025, implement comprehensive security training, conduct quarterly penetration testing, maintain $2M cyber insurance policy, establish incident response playbook, encrypt all data at rest and in transit, implement zero-trust architecture

risks.description: Unable to close Series A, runway expires before profitability
risks.mitigation: Build relationships with 25+ Series A investors starting now, achieve key metrics milestones that de-risk raise, maintain lean burn rate with 19+ months runway, prepare bridge financing options from existing angels, have contingency plan to cut burn by 40% if needed, explore revenue-based financing as backup

risks.description: Customer concentration risk (top 3 customers = 40% of revenue)
risks.mitigation: Actively diversify customer base through marketing to new segments, implement customer success program to reduce enterprise churn to <2% annually, negotiate multi-year contracts with key accounts offering 20% discount, build champion relationships at multiple levels within top accounts, develop quick-replacement customer acquisition playbook

directCompetitors.name: Asana
directCompetitors.marketPosition: Strong in general teams, weak in eng

competitiveAnalysis.ourDifferentiation: We're the only PM tool built specifically for engineering teams with AI-first automation that eliminates 60% of project management busywork. While competitors bolt on basic AI features, our entire product is designed around intelligent automation - from Git commits to stakeholder reports. We combine Linear's developer UX, Jira's power features, and AI that actually works.

marketOpportunity.sam: $8B - PM tools for software development teams
marketOpportunity.som: $400M - Mid-market SaaS companies with 50-500 employees (our initial target)

notes: This strategic plan represents our current thinking as of Q4 2024. We're at an inflection point - we've proven product-market fit with strong retention and steady growth, but need to accelerate to reach Series A metrics by Q1 2025. Our key focus areas are: 1) Hitting $100k MRR through improved conversion and expansion, 2) Reducing churn below 3% through better onboarding, 3) Closing 3 more enterprise deals to diversify revenue, 4) Building investor relationships for fundraise. The biggest risk is failing to hit metrics in time for Series A, which would force us into a difficult bridge round or aggressive cost-cutting. However, we have strong fundamentals - our AI truly works, customers love it (NPS 68), and unit economics are solid (10x LTV:CAC). With execution against this plan, we're on track to build a category-defining company.
